content:
18, 2016
												I was skeptical at first, I must admit. 4 hours in and I am more than happy with my purchase of F1 2016.So, last years iteration caught a lot of flak due to the game being practically incomplete (no safety cars, career mode, ect.) Not only that, but it was riddled with bugs to the point where it was practically unplayable. Now, normally, I would be irritated by this, but I cut Codemasters some slack. It was their first shot at an entirely new game engine. Surely, F1 2016 would be an improvement...Well? It most certainly is. With my expectations being low, Codemasters BLEW them out of the water. While the game is not PERFECT, I am finding it far more enjoyable than previous F1 titles I have invested in. There are minor graphical glitches here and there (stupid little things that won't hinder your gameplay, at least not that I've encountered). Better Yet, not once in 4 hours did the game crash to the desktop! I'm in awe!All in all, thank you, Codemasters, for listening to your fan base. You have done us a service releasing such a well done game. Here is to the future! We can only move forward!

												They done it. This game is just so ♥♥♥♥ing awesome!!! This year I found not even ONE bug in that game. Really great job from them!The most positve thing is the Career Mode . You can make your own "Legend", so you can choose your own avatar, your own car number ,helmet, name... Just great! The graphics are very very good and I have no performance bug. The curbs are so much more realistic. You must drive Italy , Monza^^ The curbs are in this game so hard . I recommened: Don't tuch at turn 1 and 2 the curbs or you'll loose sooooooooooooo much time. But the thing I miss in this game (in F1 2015 it was awesome to see) ,the sparks. I haven't seen any sparks. For me are sparks a great feature and it's awesome to see ,but in F1 2016 I never seen them :/  But still this game is awesome . I had never so much fun with an F1 game like this. But another bad thing is that the Safety Car comes not everytime out when some cars retiring when they crash with another car. Only sometimes, but still . I see it quite often. The new damage is really a challenge in league races. I had a league race in Monaco , with simulation damage. And we were 20 drivers. Me and 14 other drivers survived^^ So 5 cars crashed into a wall or something else. We had 2 safety cars and 1 virtual safety car.So now again to the Career Mode. It has so much content . I  love it to upgrade the car ,to decide what you are doing. Positive+Career Mode+Safety Car+ Virtual Safety Car+great graphics+You can choose own number, helmet, name, avatar...+no bugs+good performance+you can feel the speed very good +stable multiplayer (with 22 players it's stable too)+new damage model+you can upgrade your car (R&D)+you can adjust the cams (T-cam, offset T-cam, cockpit)+new Ai difficulty (Ultimate ,very hard you need much practice)+better and realistic curbs+realistic rain car performance +you got a agent and engineer+time of day editor+manual starts+formation lap+Manual Pit Lane Entry+new practice programsThat are the things that are in F1 2016 positive . Do you want to see something from the negative side??Negative-no sparks(fixed now)-replay fps bug (it's fixed since yesterday)I have to say very big thank you to Codemasters . I really love this game!Now let's look at some screenshots I have done!! It'S really AN AWESOME GAME

content:
ber 3, 2016
												Really happy with this purchase. Generally the only F1 game (aside from F1 2013) where I felt "That was worth the full price.".Good:- Career mode is very in depth and will keep you busy for a loooong time (I am ~25h in so far and only halfway through the first season... career mode ends at 10 (!!!) seasons).- AI is pretty good (they are fast but they also make mistakes, really enjoyable and realistic)- Strategy is very important- You can talk (with a mic) to your engineer and ask him about things like the weather forecast, strategy changes, fastest lap,...- Although I believe this game would fall into the "simcade" category, I really enjoy the handling and physics of the cars- Looks good and performance is decent- Encountered no bugs so far- A lot of settings to change everything to your liking (rebindable keys, tons of graphics settings, you can set camera positions and FOV, force feedback and wheel settings, HUD settings,...)- Safety Car, Virtual Safety Car and dynamic weather can change up races within minutes. No race is predictable- Although Mercedes are strong they are not dominating the game as much as in real life. The game has good balancing.- New difficulty settings make sure that you'll have a challenge even though you are very good- You can develop your car during practise now and purchase upgrades as the season goes on, like teams do in real life.- Much better damage model than in previous gamesBad:- It can be difficult to find a fitting difficulty setting at first. "Expert" is very slow compared to the next step called "Legend". But with "Legend" the AI is suddenly fast as ♥♥♥♥. You have to fiddle around with the settings and assists to find the perfect balance. A difficulty slider from 1-100 would have been better imo.- AI sometimes have weird strategies- Your lollipop guy keeps you hostage until there is a huge gap in the pitlane during pits. That means you can lose a lot of time if the whole grid suddenly changes tyres and goes into the pits due to a weather change or safety car for example. I had a 20+second pit stop because of that "bug", usually it should take 2-3 seconds.- Multiplayer is still a cluster♥♥♥♥ and will not provide clean and entertaining racing. Usually everyone crashes in the first corner and then 5 people leave the server. Not a fun experience.- No VR support- Tracks are not laser scanned and can feel a bit off if you compare them to Assetto Corsa or iRacing (especially Spa).- Sounds are better than before but I feel like they still sound a bit like advanced vacuum cleaners.Verdict:Overall a very good game with some minor flaws. But well worth the money if you are a F1 fan and don't care about clean multiplayer racing. I would only recommend this game if you have a controller or a wheel. It will probably not be a fun experience with a keyboard (like all racing games).

content:
20, 2016
												They made Kimi smile and Rosberg appears friendly with Hamilton. 0/10 Realism. Gut-busting banter aside, Codies have gotten it so right this time. I honestly have a hard time believing this game was made by the same people that have made the last few years' installments. I haven't looked into it, but perhaps there has been a shake-up within the development team. I have only scratched the surface of this title, but it's already miles ahead of past games. The physics feel largely revamped to the point where I felt like I had to learn to drive again, but I see that as a positive. Even playing with a controller, I can feel the car's weight. Turning into a corner at speed actually requires finesse and timing. In past games, turn-in felt effortless to me like your were driving a laserbeam. You can also really feel what your tires are doing and you'll have to tread lightly while they're still cool until you've got them up to the right temps and you can really pour on the sauce. The AI is another area where I'm noticing a huge leap forward. In past titles, I hardly ever felt like I was actually "racing" anyone. In 2016, the AI tries to maintain a natural pace through corners as well as the straights, will fight you for track position and will attempt to overtake you. The combat is satisfying. I'm also enjoying the newly added features like the development challenges you can do in the practice sessions and chatting with your engineer using a headset is pretty cool, adding to the immersion. Overall, I think F1 2016 is a very solid game. I was hesitant to spend the money as these games have been largely bland and disappointing for a few years now but I'm really pleased with what Codemasters have come up with this year. 8.5/10

												After the absolute ♥♥♥♥ stains that were 2014 - 2015, codemasters are back at it and really in the swing of things! This game feel leaps and bounds better that the last three iterations of F1 and I can happily say money well spent. So..time to get into the pros and cons-Pros->Saftey car>Formation lap cause you gotta heat them tyres son.>Graphics are decent>Ambiance is good>Great wheel and force feedback support (Thrustmaster T-150)>A.I are agresive and will pressure you to slip up>Difficulty spikes are managable >Tyres degrade realistically>New Practice session R&D keeps the game interesting>No Maldanado>Danial Riccardio's teeth are realistically portraied>Racing in The wet is super fun-Cons->Some in game videos drop to 20+fps for some reason idkw>Kevin Maggneson is a vicious killing machine and will not stop until every car on the grid is destroyed>I seen raikkonen smile/Laugh and thats not realistic at all>Too much Anthony davidson>Not enough David Coulthard>Button Needs more japanese lettering on his helmet (And not the one on his head)>Aliens still exist in multiplayer>Pretty sure i seen a Ghost in SizukaThe Bottom line.F1 2016 is different, its a love letter to you from codemasters and it says "we're sorry for making you poor with the last one... but we can change, we can take baking classes with you and really rebuild our realtionship". The game feels polished you can really see the effort was put into this one, It all feels very German, Like a it was designed by a man in a labratory with a white coat, mustache and some of those oakly reading galsses. So if you're a true F1 fan, if your a car guy, If you like things like Triganometry and the taste of magnesium behind you're nasal passages, This..is the game for you! Take it easy my friends, Stay Cheeki Breeki!

content:
ber 28, 2016
												23 hours into F1 2016 and i've decided it's time to review:This game is a triumph.For all of you who said they'd never buy again after the disaster of F1 2015 I was the same as you.F1 2015 was a complete disaster from broken multiplayer to the terrible career mode. That has all changed!Now we have proper multiplayer sessions where you can see who's hosting, which track, how many players etc etc, the way online mulitplayer SHOULD be!Career mode is a different animal all together compared to previous F1 games, you can create your own driver, pick his own number (unless it's the number already taken by a real life driver) you can create your own helmet and colour it which ever way you see fit. I know these are just small details but it makes a huge difference to how "personal" the whole game feels.In career mode you also have an agent who drops off messages and other important points of information, you have research and develpoment tasks during every practice session, giving you a reason to actually use your practice sessions, they test tyre wear over 4 laps, they test your knowledge of the track by making you hit markers around the track and you also have to beat a set time in what they call "qualifying pace" to see where you are in terms of the times they expect. All this, if passed, will give you reasearch and development points or "R&D" points which can be spent on upgrades for the teams cars, yes that's right, not just your car but your team mates too! meaning you can take McLaren from rags to riches over a couple of seasons if you so desire!All of this is fine, these mean nothing if the gameplay is poor but it is not! The feel of the cars, the graphics, everything is crisp and fantastically well made. I could go on for hours, it's 100x what 2015 was, you can talk to your garage and ask for information about fuel, tyres or even how your team mate is doing. They've added in the safety car, virtual safety cars, you can choose to do formation laps before the race start to warm the tyres. There's even manual starts where you have to hold the clutch and release it and accelerate to give the game a more natural start, rather than just holding the accelerator down and the computer do the rest, you can even get punished for jump starting. I cannot express enough my delight at the new career mode as it's what i've always enjoyed doing, I was so bitterly disappointed last year and was so hoping this year would be better and they delivered way beyond anything I expected.All-in-all the game is a triumph, from career mode rivalries with other drivers to competing for top stop within the team, it's everything I hoped for and more, thank you for listening to the players and giving us a game that is actually worthy of the F1 logo!10/10

												Oh God, this is the most detailed hand crafted carved F1 and racing game ever. It's almost perfect. The simulation is ♥♥♥♥ing awesome, it captures in a low abstraction level what it is an F1 car, the tyre management is ♥♥♥♥ing awesome, the fuel, the tyres! GOD the CRASH SYSTEM is the most MOST detailed, natural and sensitive system that I've ever seen in a game, this is in the whole sense of the word A SIMULATOR.The immersive experience is INCREDIBLE it captures the whole thing about being an F1 driver, since the manager, the crew chief, the contracts, the career, the development of the car, the improvement system, R&D program, the advantage of the teams due to investment on R&D, all the aspects of a car and its phases of improvement, how it works in real life. SIMPLY PERFECT, this is the FIFA 17 or maybe 18 of the racing games.NOT FOR ARCADE GAMERS, This is a simulator, the driving is HARD, of course you can customize the difficulty level BUT the top level is REAL, it's hard and the AI is hard to beat, they try to win really, overtakes and agressive conduction. There is PRO CAREER MODE where you can't touch anything of the options because is the REAL level, regarding to the level of AI, the duration of practices, NO FLASH BACKS, EVERYTHING REAL, NO FEEDBACK FROM ON SCREEN DISPLAYS. I'd say Lewis Hamilton could play it for now, it takes time to perfect the technique you have to be more than a PRO to win in the CAREER PRO.I understand that things on the way you create your driver, the face, and the helmet could be improved BUT COME ON! Codemasters worked reallly hard to bring this artwork, this masterpiece.This is an eSport absolutely.

number of helpful: 18 of 18 people (100%) found this review helpful3 people found this review funny
content:
27
												Seeing that this title is on sale for the start of the 2017 season, I feel obligated to post a review to interested F1 fans who are yet to pull the trigger.This game is very nearly a masterpiece for an F1 fanatic. It's well optimized, it controls well, and you can customize the game settings and assists on your vehicle to make the game as hard or as easy as you'd like.This is the first F1 game for me. I've been playing using all three practice sessions and qualifying before taking on the full length race. I have to say that it is an incredible experience to progress through each step leading up to lights out.  The progression of learning the track, advancing your skills, and testing different tire, car setup, and fuel strategies pays off on race day.The tracks look gorgeous, and they are very true to their real life counterparts including the brand new Baku Circuit.  Weather affects your control heavily, and you can absolutely feel the difference in your vehicle's grip from the start of P1 to the end of Quali as more rubber is put down on the track.The AI is challanging in my opinion. They are agressive and they don't all mirror each other's strategies. You'll see a variety of tire compounds starting on race day and different pit strategies. Every once in a while you'll have an opponent spin you out from behind, but hey, that's what flashbacks are for!Last item of the positives: Voice commands for pit crew / race updates! So awesome!The only negatives I've found:Tire strategies during weather events are difficult because the AI has an advantage of knowing the better time to switch between slicks and intermediates/wets.Multiplayer doesn't have the same "feel" as single player.Sometimes AI will pull clearly illegal moves, but hey, can't be perfect all the time.In conclusion, It really feels like you are competing at the F1 level until you have to pause mid race to use the restroom.9.5/10

												This game is seriously good.This is the Dirt Rally of the F1 series. The level of detail, settings and immersion is far and away better than any other codemasters F1 games to date. This game is suitable for the diehard fans and newcomers to the series with the wide option of assists and difficulty settings it has to offer.A few highlights/major improvements on past installments of the F1 series include full 22 player multiplayer races and championships. The connection issues of previous games finally seem to have been solved, while there's also the ability for you to reconnect to a race if your net drops. Career mode has returned with more detailed and realistic practice sessions that help you tailor your car setup to the track. Practice sessions also offer you the chance to earn tokens for car development. You can now also set multiple weather patterns for a race. Want it to start wet, then dry up and finish wet again, you can finally do that now.If you like F1 games then this is a must buy! It's simply so much better than any of the previous games. Even if you're not particularly an F1 fan but like racing games in general, then you'll enjoy this too as it has so much to offer.

content:
ber 3, 2016
												The F1 experience you've been waiting for. Puts all previous F1 games to shame in every possible way. With a focus on realisim, this is the best example of what a simcade racing title can be when done right. Featuring an indepth career, proper R&D with practice session tasks to gain R&D points that you can spend to upgrade your car as the season goes on, and contract offers to advance to different teams. Stunningly beautiful graphics and brilliant car simulation physics really immerse you in the world of open wheel racing. All in all, this is simply one of the best racing games of the decade.

number of helpful: 14 of 16 people (88%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
20, 2016
												This is by far the best F1 game in a long time!Feels like the Force Feedback has been completely rebuilt and feels good, although once controlling the car steering feels loose until you hit the full steering lock left/right. It's like your calibrating the wheel real time. Not sure if that's to simulate fresh tires or not but it certainly is interesting. I end up off track more times than not because pit assist on rejoining track will suddenly give you control right before a hard turn.Control mappings from wheel show controller buttons for on screen menu navigation even when a controller isn't plugged in, no don't show off you're a console port! Sense of speed feels good, and careful throttle application is required exiting turns no matter how fast your going. Maybe a higher downforce setup would mitigate this, would make sense just haven't tested this yet. To me it feels like the F1 series magnifies every small mistake, something that I'm not neccessarily a fan of but it does make it more challenging and fun to master.  In race settings you can enable formation lap, then you can try to get your tires and brakes at optimal temperature, and it feels simply amazing having full control of the car following the pace car around the track. Problem is you don't get to pull up to your grid spot as control is taken away, then suddenly a quick screen flash which seems to refresh the grid for the start of the race. I'm truely impressed here, I just wish they would redo pitting entirely giving you full control and take the car off rails entering and leaving your pit stall.Even with all it's problems as is, F1 2016 shows potential to be truely epic. 9/10Pros:+ Career Mode+ Choose Your First & Last Name, Car Number (x74), Helmet (x46),  Avatar (x20)+ New Practice Development Programs (Track Climitisation, Tyre Management, Qualifying+ Agent & Engineer Face Time+ R&D (Research & Development)+ Three Driving Cameras (Cockpit, TV-Pod, Offset TV-Pod)+ Great Performance+ Good Sense Of Speed+ Stable Multiplayer (22 Players)+ New Damage Model+ Very Good Physics+ Better and Realistic Curbs+ Safety Car+ Virtual Safety Car+ Awesome Graphics+ New Ai difficulty (Ultimate)+ Realistic Rain Car Performance+ Time of Day Editor+ Manual Starts+ Formation Lap+ Manual Pit Lane Entry+ Good Steering Wheel SupportCons:- User Interface Needs A PC Touch no Function Buttons Please- Ai Needs Work- Low FPS in Hospitality Hub- Needs More Commentator Dialogue- Force Feedback Needs Tweaked

number of helpful: 12 of 13 people (92%) found this review helpful3 people found this review funny
content:
25, 2016
												If you are reading this and you are like me and have been sadly very disappointed by the recent F1 games here is what you need to know.9/10 - Season & Career single player modes are both in-depth & immersive. 7/10 - AI has been greatly improved, It's still not human but it's the closest it has ever been. (keep an eye out for AI in the wet, they drive like they are in the dry)8/10 - Visually the game is stunning even at 4K or 21:9 & wider. (still clearly bound by console fidelity)9/10 - Engine Sound, yes its the turbo era, But Codemasters have nailed the sound even down the finest of engine/turbo details. They really did some work here.8/10 - Atmosphere sound is rich and immersive with great menu music & some of the best commentary the franchise has ever featured. (Sadly no Martin Brundle or Ted Kravitz)8/10 - Racing Wheel & Pedal FFB & feeling is great. It's not Assetto Corsa but even a finely tuned Fanatec wheel owner can still enjoy some of the detailed rear wheel slip or kerb feeling.7/10 - Car Handling and Physics are improved. Again this isn't Assetto Corsa or iRacing level. Dry racing is still on rails, wet weather feel has seen some improvements and feel more challenging & rewarding when perfected.8/10 - Track design has finally been updated to better represent the real life counter-parts. Some tracks had previously not seen layout updates they where first implemented in F1 2010. Melbourne T10 to T11 no longer has grass against the wall. FINALLY!!!!!!9/10 - Voice Command, This feature seems trivial. But it simply works, see the list of valid commands below and make sure you speak with a clear tone of voice into your mic. "Leave Me Alone" & "Shut Up Jeff" are genuinely valid responses just FYI. LOL!!!Overall this franchise has finally seen some love & revitalization it badly needed. While I understand the difficulties of a yearly cycle, this looks like a game they spent 2 years making not 12 months.*At time of writing I have not tested multiplayer/netcode. I will update once tested.VOICE COMMANDS:box this lapfull race updatedriver in frontdriver behindwho am i racingtyre statusvehicle conditionweather reportfuel informationpit stop informationset hard tyresset medium tyresset soft tyresset super soft tyresset ultra soft tyresset intermediatesset full wetsadjust wing upset wing balancechange wing downteam mate statusrival statusfastest lap overallbest lap updatelast lap timechampionship standingsengineer quietengineer talkengineer repeatfewer updatesmore updatesshut up jeffleave me alone

number of helpful: 12 of 13 people (92%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
24, 2016
												Easily the best entry in the Formula 1 game franchise by Codemasters. Pretty much everything about this game is perfectly crafted. From the actual SkySports commentary for pre and post session cutscenes, to the implementation of the 2016 tire rules. The career mode is like nothing I've seen in a very long time in the all the best ways. It's somewhat reminiscent of the career modes that EA crafted in the peak of their NASCAR liscense days. NASCAR Thunder 2004 had hands-down my favorite career mode in any racing game, but F1 2016 is giving it a run for it's money.I have only a few minor complaints, and it's all mostly cosmetic. The two biggest is simply that there are no female avatars to choose from in career mode, and that there are no interviews like there were in F1 2010. Otherwise, I miss the loading screens like they had in F1 2013 and 14 (though since it loads in the background during menus it's really not a big deal), and the fact that it's kinda poorly optimized. This is the first game I've encountered that my PC doesn't meet at least the minimum specs for, but on the default settings I do usually get around 60fps anyway. The paddock scenes actually kill my FPS the most. The physics model is a little bit tricky to get a hold of, but once I had the proper wheel settings and got some practice on the track it felt pretty natural and somewhat similar to the 2015 McLaren in iRacing and the 2015 Ferrari in Assetto Corsa.If you are a fan of racing games, Formula 1, or perhaps even sim games in general I think this title is worth a serious consideration.tl;drPros:Career mode rocksThe AI are challenging, and will actually attempt to pass youThe presentation is greatVoice commands work really wellCons:No female avatars (F1 Championship Edition did this 10 years ago)No interviews in career mode like 2010Kinda poorly optimized (Still getting around 60fps tho)

content:
er 25, 2016
												Edit: CM has said that they will not update this game anymore... Shame for themI would like to recommand this version of F1 if Codemaster fixes bugs. Being a Formula 1 fan and having played F1 2005 on PS2, F1 2009 on both PSP and Wii with 100% race on careers, and F1 2015 during the freeplay (which was kind of rubbish tbh), F1 2016 is way better than its predecessors (Graphics, gameplay, tire management and settings, etc.). So for its pros:-Awesome graphics and framerate for middle-end GPU (you can race at around 30fps on heavy rain with a car crashing in front of you)-Realistic sounds (the motor sound is quite original to the V6 hybrids)-Safety car with VSC both back -Choice to manually control the speed when entering to the pit lane-Choice to start a race manually, needing to wait the red light to go off and engage the clutcher-Possibility to have a race at any time during the day, eg Abu Dhabi at noon (rip tires)-You can let your engineer via TR to shut up ("Shut up Jeff" is actually an achievement)-An indicator that shows you how far is the DRS line-Tire management improved, the effects of the rain on slick tires are more obvious (drop of tire temperature and lap time)Cons:-UNAVAILABLE Career mode. I just simply can't start a career as the game crashes each time I start the FP1 in Melbourne. It crashes right after the presentation of the circuit, no matter how many times I reinstalled the game.-The track dries too quickly, being a bit unrealistic (Two laps after the rain stops on full race, everyone enters to the pits and changes inters to soft tires.)-A bug about TR that happened several times, I am playing on X1 controller, but sometimes when I just want to get "Full race updates"(on the first page, second choice) it chooses mysteriously "Get intermediates tyres (on the second page choice 4)".- Jeff says "The weather is unavailable" during weather changes (eg from heavy to light rain), so you don't know if you need to continue on your current tyres or going back to the pits to cahnge tires, and it will be much decisive if you do not want to be undercut.-Both hands of the driver being away from the steering wheel at the end of a race (if you achieve first) but the car turns magically (eg after crossing the finish line in Mexico).-Formation laps are meaningless as you can hit the wall and overtake as many times as you want, without having any penalities or damage on the car.-A bug when the safety car is out, the driver in front of you may be overtaken if he goes off the track just a little-Kimi smiles at the podium XDIn overall, F1 2016 is a great game IF bugs are being fixed. :-(

number of helpful: 10 of 11 people (91%) found this review helpful
content:
r 8, 2016
												Finally another F1 game that's worth its price! I must admit that Codemasters did a really good job on this one.F1 2016 is - as the name reveals - licensed for the current season with all your favorite Formula One drivers from Hamilton over Grosjean to Haryanto. The graphics look almost lifelike and the different tracks feel like the real thing.Positive:- safety car and virtual safety car included- stands and pit lane feel alive with an audience and the crews present- pit garage is beautifully animated- cars feel balanced- training programmes during free practice provide motivation for collecting development points which you can invest for upgrades to your car over the season- career mode is lots of fun- animations before practice/qualifying/race add to the feeling of being a part of F1, as does the possibility to do a formation lap before race start- weather changes are quite challenging- very good damage models and collision simulationNegative:- even with a very good graphic card that can handle the settings on ultra, the game still sometimes loads stuff in the background and becomes rather bumpy, which sucks especially while driving through corners- AI behaves rather erratically at times- keyboard users are at a disadvantage at the tire wear training programme. The handling is too harsh if you don't use a controller or steering wheelI haven't tested the online multiplayer yet, so I can't say anything about it.All in all this is the best F1 game I've played since F1 Racing Championship. I can definitely recommend it to all racing fans out there.

ber 30, 2016
												I played every F1 game from codemasters besides 2015 and this game is by far the best!The force feedback and physics are way better than 2014 and as always the graphics are amazing.I also like the option to completely disable your hud and just rely on your engineer which leads to amazing immersion!Also the AI is like 100 times better than in F1 2014 or earlier. Again I can't compare this to 2015.I can give you a little example: In my first race I drove without the hud and everything was working fine, but in the end of the race I got a radio problem, so I couldn't communicate with the engineer. The last thing I knew was that my engine is loosing power and that the RedBull behind me is coming closer rapidly. Because I didn't knew how many laps were remaining I got super nervous and just hoped for the checkered flag each lap. As you can probably guess, it was an amazing experience and this game may be the first F1 game in which I will complete a whole 100% distance season.In conclusion I can say that although this game got no super hardcore physics like other sims on the market, the pure racing and immersion combined with solid physics and force feedback position this game on the must have list for every racing enthusiast!

content:
ber 21, 2016
 The best F1 Game ever? To make it short:  YES! "But why?" I hear many of you cry.I own F1 2010 and 2013, and have played every demo for the games that I didn't have.So, why do I love this game so much?- The handling of the cars just feels  real  I have never had so much fun experiencing such high performance realistic driving models. I don't know. I never drove a F1 car myself, but if I could, I would imagine it behave exactly like this game suggests.- The presentation is really, really good! Apart from the overall superior graphical quality, you feel like really being a participant in one of the best sports there is.- What I personally find most interesting about F1, is the tactics. And maaaan, this game is nailing it. You are able to accurately adapt your tactics to your driving style and your engineer even suggests possible changes of tactics, reacting to current race events (such as change in weather, safety car, or other cars with unexpected speeds are observed - do you want the same tires?). This is very useful and expands your F1 gaming expierience by a lot. You even have the chance to test your personal tyre usage on the track, adapting the race tactics to you personally, which is nice.Another great thing about F1 2016 is that you see how much dedication the devs put into this piece of software and how much of badasses and racing game developer extraordinaires work at this studio. There is so much love to detail!Of course there are bugs.But you know what? Almost weekly updates do a great job fixing them. I once encountered a sound bug. 7 hours later it was fixed.The only real thing which disturbs my experience is some kind of unbalanced AI. You know, at track A I have absolutely no problem winning, whilst on track B, I hardly manage to make it into top 10. But that's nothing that cannot be tweaked over time. Maybe I'm just a noob who likes certain tracks more than others and my own performance is varying so much.But I will keep this review updated as soon as something changes. Cheers!Have fun with this game!

												I've only played 5 hours so far so here's my early impressions: It's already better than F1 2015 in every way. I put over 50 hours into F1 2015.First off, the game was is more optismised than than last year's title. On my 970, I'm getting over 100 fps on high settings in both dry and wet conditions. Wet conditions on the previous game would always have severe drops to 30-40 when driving near a few other cars. The last game also had micro stutters occasionly. I have yet to get any in this game.The actual driving is largely the same. I've noticed the rear tyres don't spin up as much which I always thought was a bit extreme in F1 2015. It's still more arcadey than sim but honestly I'm fine with that. The addition of steam workshop support for car setups is a nice feature.It's got a proper career mode! And the best in the series to date! I love the addition of the track acclimatisation, tyre management and qualifying simulation programs in the practice sessions. It's a great way of prepping for the race and improving your car during the season by earning R&D points. I started my career in Manor with the aim of bringing the team closer to the front of the grid.I've seen a few bugs, such as a UI graphic that stayed on screen for an entire race and a floating ghost driver during a single-shot qualifying session. No crashes thus far. The multiplayer isn't broken at launch like the last game.I just want to play more!

												Loving it.  I skipped 2015 due to a lack of career mode and generally unfavourable reviews so my opinons on this are based on a comparison to 2014 (which I loved).  -Career Mode feels immersive-New R&D format is fun and feels rewarding-the graphics are a large upgradeTook me a little bit to get used to the steering and I miss the old tyre/fuel menu whilst driving but now that I'm getting comfortable with it I like it. number of helpful: 5 of 6 people (83%) found this review helpful
content:
25, 2016
												I've got to say. I went into this title with medium to high expectations that were shattered by some ctds, clunkyness on menus etc... updated my drivers all went to normal with a couple of 2 ctds after last patch on august 24th. August 25th all smooth, no issues whatsoever. Pretty unusual, so let's begin.Straight into business: This is the best F1 game I ever played. Not that the bar is set through the roof with the legends as F1 2002 by EA, Grand Prix 2, 3 and 4 set in the past, but overall this is a up to par title.Personaly it is the best. Technicaly, F1 2016 can be said that is in the same tier with the release dates put into account.Break Down>Sounds  6/10 : Starting with the bad part of this game. A heck ton of glitches in the sound system. It absolutely needs patches as of August 25th. Cars inside the pits being ultra loud, sounds cutting out, etc...Graphics  9.5/10 : Gorgeous game. You can check youtube videos for general feel. Dust effects looks much improved maybe thanks for Dirt Rally from the same devs. Amazing.Gameplay  8.5/10 : You can talk with your engineer for race/event information with your microphone, examples: tyre wear, info about car in front and behind, pit strategies, accept new strategies or decline, tell him to shut the ♥♥♥♥ up etc... This blew my ♥♥♥♥ing mind (getting old as ♥♥♥♥). Features and features improved from previous titles for the better experience to the player. A few problems with menu flow and it's animations (it's slow).Physics 8/10 (PLAYING WITHOUT STEERING WHEEL AT THE MOMENT; check other reviewers with steering wheel experiences to match yours) The cars have weight finally. Their behavior is even more believable than in previous titles. Cannot say much technicaly, but it feels good.Features 9.5/10: You get carreer, you get custom championship made by you, you get time trial and able to rival another human on the leader board with access to his car set up, you get a lot of options in graphics to controls and hud. Car setups are there with the new rules and both safety car and vitual safety car. Everything looks fine at features unless you look at how you set up the AI difficulty. Next item VVV.AI  7.5/10: It's a stone in the shoes of codie's F1. Quite a lot of people complaining about the AI difficulty gap between 2 sets of pre defined difficulty levels from the devs. They REALLY should put in difficulty by % and not 5 presets for the player to choose.I don't mind agressive AI at all but sometimes an AI driver behind gets clueless about your movement and may make you spin in a straight. Once made contact on their front wheel with you rear wheel they force you to spin instead of backing off. This happens with VERY low frequency.They are getting there, personaly I preffer this than the glorious F1 2013.Replayability 10/10: The game is made for you to come back. You can be the guy/girl that plays championships outside career mode, you can be the guy/girl that plays only career (there's a ton of content there), you can be the casual that plays one 5 lap to 25% laps race a day, you can be the guy/girl that plays 75% to 100% races, doesn't matter...I had F1 2013 in a pedestal in my mind from the Codemaster's F1 games. I replaced it with F1 2016.Just the voice comands to ease on workload while increasing workload in other areas while you're racing is great. It's a treat to F1 nerds.Solid 8.5/10. Can be a shiny 9/10 if patches iron every little tinny imperfections.

content:
r 17, 2016
												I will make this review as short as I can. The game is really good as a whole, it has bugs but very few and Codemasters are trying their best to polish it up. I played F1 2014 and when I came to F1 2016 it was a whole new game, the feeling of the cars and the grip you have but when you lose it. Well if you've seen F1 races those barriers you see along the track is now your new friend.  A Side Story:That is of course if you get that far with friends "not doing it on purpose mind you" Friend saying: "oh hey I'm next to you, but your faster then me go ahead of me" You saying:"thanks" then you go into the apex at the corner to only be greeted with your friend's front wing into your side.  Friend saying: "I'm sorry I couldn't break in time" You: "sigh since your front wing is gone and go into pit with him" Friend gets out of the pit in front of you and you watch as he barrel's into the first corner. The Ai bump into him at the corner to get on the racing line for him to only fly into the barrier and lose his front wing again. You: "Start laughing so hard." Friend: "not happy and sighing"  You: "then look at your position "11th"you go into a serious One Punch Man mode". You: "Focusing so hard you start catching the driver's ahead for 10th-6th, for only Jeff to come on the comms and say "pit strategy change" you look down for a second to change it, look up and Ai are braking for the turn you brake hard and your wheel comes off while hitting the barrier." You just stare at the screen saying "Jeff never talk to me in the corner's!!!" Friend ask "what happened?" You: just sit in silence watching your friend race. 20 minutes later Friend is in 8th going for 7th. As you watch him catch the Ai, it suddenly teleports in front of him and he brakes hard into the turn to only lose his wheel. You: laugh and asked "what happened?"10/10 Racing is fun with friends onlinePros:+Career is back with more depth+R&D for Career+Pick your own Driver and work your way up with a bad team+Feeling of the car's+Graphics+Immersion+Ai challenges you+Curbs are less forgiving if you full throttle on them+No large assist help (holding hand/under the hood, with all assist off) for pad users"FYI I'm a pad user"+Multiplayer Championship+22 playable gird position's for online+Search online lobbies+Safety Car and Virtual Safety CarCons:-Ai are really aggressive if you are slower then them (I'm learning to get used to them but it might be a problem at first for new drivers)-R&D is short for Career (All the Upgrades in two Seasons(A mod improves it though))-No R&D for online Championships-No Podiums/ Track Intro's Online (Toogle On/Off Option?)-Online issues playing with others around the world sometimes-Ai are getting away with no penalties sometimes online-Ghosting Cars Online (Toogle On/Off Option?)*The con's are more towards online but it's still enjoyable

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
19, 2016
												**** Initial Review **** More Detailed Review Below ****Just over 4 hours in and this is a much better game than previous versions.Had a lot of fun with the R&D in Career mode.  The tasks are like mini-games you have to complete in order to progress.Learning to drive with the new physics. Cars feel like they slide around a lot more this year (no assists).Graphics are improved significantly with some of the biggest improvements being the lighting and reflections on the cars.The sound of the cars is realistic, and the commentary and voice work is varied and of a good standard. The race engineer has a lot more to say than before and can now even read your lap times for you.Great game so far, very challenging.**** More Details ****Off the bat, it is clear that this is the very best version of the F1 series made by Codemasters so far.Presentation is about as good as you can expect from any modern racing game, and the way it is done here has the potential to immediately suck in any F1 fan.  A very smooth and simple interface allows you to quickly jump into any race around the 20 circuits available on the calendar as any one of the 22 drivers and 11 teams on the roster this year.  For a more in-depth experience you can play the Career mode which allows you to select your own driver avatar, name and number and pick which team and team-mate you race with for the 10 season campaign.  Career mode is beefed up this year, in addition to your laptop, you get access to an agent and an engineer who assists with contract negotiations and R&D updates respectively.  These are simple tocuhes and whilst updated on previous iterations (the motorhome and laptop 2013 - I think?).The Career season itself is customizable allowing you to set anything from Full Race Weekends to various shorter versions and race lengths from 3 Laps to 100% Races.The difficulty settings range from Very Easy to Ultimate, and new level more difficult than the previous highest difficulty setting - Legend and there's something for everyone.Unlike previous games, leaving on the driving assists doesn't actually do much to slow the driver, so you are not rewarded as such for driving with no assists vs assists.R&D tests are offered during Practice Sessions on Career Mode which add a few fun minigames which can be done during practice laps. Success in these tests are rewarded with R&D points which can be used to improve your car over time allowing a Manor to eventually have enough parts to challenge a Merc (in theory).  The results of the R&D tests can be viewed, and actually an help the player become more precise at placing the car and making the tyres last longer.The podium is available for the winner and two runners up. The animations are better than previous games, and are just a nice little touch which you do not get with simulators such as Assetto Corsa (another fantastic racing game/sim).Replays are available after races, with the standard range of cameras to review the race. The ability to flip between drivers has remained and makes for some good fun watching incidents and accidents between other drivers.Time Trials have new features as well as keeping all the old ones from F1 2015. Now you can race rivals and also get access to the setups of all the other drivers on the leaderboard allowing you to benefit from the tried and tested settings.  I personally love this as I am horrible at setting up a car myself.There is also the ability to download various car setups posted on the Steam Workshop from other players (thanks guys! :) ) which is immensively helpful to everyone from the complete novice (like myself) to a budding engineer aiming to be the new Adrian Newey.As of yet, I have not delved into Multiplayer which now has Lobbies and also a time delayed Multiplayer Co-op championship (I think).Just about everything you could want for this game exists here in this version.  Short of adding a part where the player can be Lewis Hamilton during his time off, there's not much more that could be done.Over time, I think there will be better and more immersive versions of this series, but for now, this is as good as it gets.

content:

												Improvements all round!Handling improved.AI improved (and can actually battle without jumping out the way).Difficulty options - some very tough difficulties available.In race data and strategies.Pratice objectives that make it feel worthwhile.R&D throughout the season.Weather and lighting - my goodness they have nailed time of day lighting and weather fronts rolling in.Delta times - really useful for hot laps and to see where you are gaining or losing time.Rivals during time trials make it much more interesting.I could go on and on. What an improvement since this all started with F1 2010. Well done Codies, exactly what we have been asking for! Once of the best, if not the best, F1 games to date. I nearly missed this title, but saw YouTubers playing it with early copies. Developers could learn a lot from this - if you have faith in your title and nothing to hide, put out some early copies!

number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
19, 2016
												Previously I mainly played F1 2013, i.e. I've never touched the V6-era F1 car in any game (clearly Real Racing 3 shouldn't count). The first feeling I got from this game was that -- the car is sliding everywhere! I firstly thought this is because of my controller setting, then realized that we actually have much weaker aerodynamics in F1 nowadays. That explains. Nevertheless, if you're switching from the Codies' V8-era game (before and including F1 2013), you might have a big performance defeicit compared to your level before (like I do). I used to play against legend AI and could easily beat them in F1 2013, but now I find my pace roughly the same as an expert AI in F1 2016. Practicing should make me more fluent in this game anyway, but I do feel this game is more difficult than F1 2013. By far I also think Red Bull is slightly faster than Ferrari in this game, which is kinda realistic. 10/10

content:
r 5, 2016
												If you are using a gamepad, such as an xbox controller, steer away from this game. Although the game itself for the most part seems like a good game, it is unfortunately ruined by a very high input delay for gamepads. I have tried every combination of the (quite limited) control options to no avail. The core issue seems to be a very low saturation on the rate of steering input. That is, try moving your controls from far right to far left, it will take several seconds before the game reaches far left which you can see from the visual response of the steering wheel. Unfortunately, it is so slow that it is impossible to counter-steer if you have a bit of oversteer. You don't really feel the car and can't make any quick adjustments, which just ruins the immersion. A very conservative and predictable driving style is necessary just to keep the car on the road.From the discussion I've read, driving wheels do not seem to have this issue as the game input is one-to-one with your steering wheels angle. If this is what you're using, I'm sure you'll enjoy this game. It's unfortunate what seems like a small fix for Codemasters completely ruins the game experience for me and many others. I've gone back and reinstalled F1 2012 which just feels so much better. There is some steering rate saturation here as well as is natural for gamepad inputs, but it is so much faster and feels much better. My recommendation is stick to 2012 or 2013 until Codemasters fix this issue - if they ever do. Meanwhile I urge the developers to add options for the input rate saturation and any other parameters that the game uses for gamepad inputs.Update: I found a video demonstrating the control issues: 


YouTube™ Video:

content:
r 2, 2016
												Finally a decent F1 game from Codemasters.Pros:- Nice graphics.- A very interesting and immersive career mode with lots of features: Character customization, car development and actually workable R&D tests and many more.- Very decent physics.- Tyre wear seems not to be scripted anymore.- Improved voice recognition (The engineer finally understands my Greek accent :D).- You have more control of your car (Manual starts, manual slow down at the pit entry, chose if to repair damage or not etc).- More strict and fair penalty system (It still needs some work though).- More sensitive car damage and a small improvement in damage model.- Better online experience with less lag and less aliens :3.- More customisable races (Scripted weather, race time etc)- A realistic race weekend with tyre choices and all the practice sessions.Cons:- Driver faces are terribly designed. My eyes are burnt!- Damage model should be more detailed. Suspension damage for example does not exist. It's only wheel on, wheel off.- Physics need some improvements too (They are not bad though).- The info menu right down is not so easy to use (Sometimes I lose my focus to the race because of that).- A.I. should be a little bit more aggressive. Especially in higher difficulties.- The engine failures happen very often which is not reallistic.- Virtual Safety Car's and Safety Car's pace is terrible and very unstable. Also the delta during these periods is completely ♥♥♥♥ as the A.I. go slower than it. Furthermore the A.I. slow down instantly which is really dangerous if you're right behind them.- The jump from Expert to Legend difficulty is still an issue.- Mid Session Save is buggy. When you load a Mid Session Saved race I just get a freezed black screen.What the game misses:- Dedicated servers!- Manual pitstops.- Detailed damage model as I said above.- Gearbox failures and any other similar to that.- ERS!- More difficulties and a detailed difficulty menu (Like A.I. pace, aggression and mistakes).In conclusion: It's worth to buy it but not for 50 euros. Maybe 30-40 euros would be ok (At least in my opinion). It's the most completed F1 game from Codemasters so far. The first game after F1 2013 that keeps my interest more than a week and without getting bored. They've made some serious ♥♥♥♥ for the first time! 10/10 IGN.........The first time I'm not done with an F1 game!

content:
r 7, 2016
												*Disclaimer* Sorry if my english is not 100% accurate sometimes, french-speaking guy here.After the flops of 2014 and 2015, F1 2016 didn't disappoint me. Here's my pros and cons.Pros:- Nice handling- Intense racing- AI make mistakes, and therefore alter the race. It can catch off-guard on your strategy with pitstops, and sometimes screws you up big time.- Looks great to me, but not exceptional- Nice rewind duration, allows you to really correct a mistake you made- The career mode is nice- The formation lap and the podium scene are great added features!Cons:- The AI are sooo dangerous! I just finished an intense race at Barcelona where I had to defend my 1st place to Hamilton. The battle lasted like 4-5 laps, and I had to defend my position on the pit straight. Even though I swerved only once to the right to defend, Hamilton rammed in there and spun us both out 3 times on 3 different occasions. And that is not the only occurence, Vettel did the same thing to me in Sochi on the pit straight.- These so-called "programmes" in the career mode. Man.. It's amusing at first, but quickly boring, especially the tires one. Now I totally understand that it's part of the job as a driver to deliver data for your team so they can improve, but.. yea. I'd rather do them all at once if I could! :PNevertheless, that game is great. I retrieved the feeling I had in 2013, only the handling is smoother in my opinion. Many hours of fun are ahead of me. :D

Product received for free
												I'm an occasionnal racing game player and so far I love F1 2016. I was hesitant to pick this one up because of all the bad reviews and bugs from the last year version. No crash or bugs. I had no problems running this game with a gtx 980ti with 60fps or more all the time on Acer predator X34 (21:9 ratio supported). There seems to be performance issue with the player hub in carreer mode where the fps drop really low but that wont keep you from enjoying the game. My only deception is that the game don't support multi gpu SLI.My thrustmaster t500rs wheel work really well and the forcefeed back is amazing. No configuration needed. Everything just work as it should.Graphics are good espescially in rain condition. I think Project cars look better than this.Gameplay is great. It's a bit more arcade than Project cars but I like this way. The cars feel and handle very good. You wont have you car drifting and going out of control if you push the gas pedal too hard like Pcars. It's alot less punishing when you make a mistake.I mostly played the carreer mode. It's very addicve as you'll want to make your pilot progress by completing team objectives, face to face challenge and gain experience points that you can spend to upgrade your car by achieving race objective.  Unlike the empty and uninteresting Pcars carreer mode this one is great.The ai seems ok. They wont bump into you unless you make something really unsual. I'm playing at medium difficulty and I'm having alot of fun.The voice control for strategy, pit options and info on the race is a nice feature. I like it. It's easier to stay focus on the race than trying to manually navigate the menu.I compared alot to Pcars because this was my favorite racing sim with a wheel. I never played any F1 20xx before.Overall it's a must buy if you like F1 racing game.

content:
20, 2016
												If you've been waiting on the side lines, like me, for Code Masters to get their act together with the F1 genre (since 2012) - rest assured they have finally got there. This game is excellent!AI drivers are no longer just a wet sponge that you easily overtake and never see again. They crash, they barge into you and each other and they go through phases just like in the current generation of F1. After fighting my way to the front of a race, I pitted and undercut Vettel to be 2nd behind Rosberg. He pitted as well and after being neck and neck, he pulled away to finish with a 16 second gap in the end. Meanwhile, Hamilton came from 5th after the last round of pit stops and was scrapping with me for 2nd. Add to this the fact that your team are constantly evaluating your options for undercuts and changes of strategy based on race conditions and how well you're protecting your tyres, and it feels like you're racing in real life.Code Masters have finally listened to their customers and added the in-depth R&D - which introduces more RPG elements to the game. You can start with a front-running team and still upgrade the car, or take a lower tier car and hunt down the front runners over time. I was really worried they would stuff this up but it's pretty much spot on.I don't play much online, but there is also an online multiplayer championship, and all of the usual matchmaking head-to-head (full 22 cars!).

												A fantastic combination of simulation and gaming elements. Obviously because it's designed to appeal to the masses, it's not a full blown "Sim", but the total package of the F1 race weekend, R&D, tyre/fuel strategies and the "Formula One atmosphere" make it easily the best Codemasters F1 Game since F1 2010. Whilst the game is visually stunning, it does need some performance optimisations as it can lead to a pretty poor frame rate if you choose to turn everything up to "11", so to speak. Console ports tend to do that...The AI are also rather unbalanced when it comes to Practice/Qualifying pace versus Race pace. In practice and qualifying they're lightning quick, but in the race they're much slower, meaning you often have to change difficulty levels between qualifying and the race. A very worthy successor to F1 2010. The rest are garbage in comparison. 8/10.

content:

												I am 5 hours into my career at the time of writing this review. I have to say that I'm very impressed by this game. I own F1 2010, 2011, 2012, 2013, 2014, and now 2016. The 2015 game did not work for me when I bought it, and I returned it shortly after, hoping that the 2016 iteration would be better optimised for PC users. F1 2016 seems to have reinvigorated the series, after two lackluster titles in 2014 and 2015. The visuals are gorgeous, the game is streamlined, and I get great FPS on my system (i3-2120, Radeon HD 7970, 6G RAM) which is by no means a top tier system, all while running on medium/high settings. The safety car and career mode are both back which are major plusses as well. The customizable player character is also a nice addition. I see on the community pages that people are having difficulties running the game, and I can only hope that Codies' do their best to provide patches allowing people to play this game. It is as good as F1 2013, and that's saying something. Recommended.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
18, 2016
This is the F1 game you have been looking for.Be warned, this is a long one. If you are looking to buy the game then maybe this will help.     Where do I start? F1 2016 is the F1 game that we have been waiting for. Immediatley starting to drive yielded noticable improvements that made me feel much more satisfied with this years installment. Now, if you were like me, you watched almost every single pre-release video from the likes of xMattyG1 and Tiametmarduk, so there weren't any huge surprises with any big new features. Despite the element of surprise not being there, I was still excited to start my Career Mode, and to see the all the detail in the paddock.     I want to go over one thing more than everything else, which will be summarised below, and that thing is Career Mode, and things that you will encounter while racing in it.      Career Mode is back and better than ever. With a more in-depth look at the life of a Formula 1 driver, you will be sucked into the game more than ever before. You are given ten seasons to compete in, either moving around to get to the top, or making your favourite team the one to beat. You are able to fully customise your avatar, choosing from a multitude of appearances and helmets (which you can customise further). You are also able to pick your own number, besides ones that are either in use or retired.     Testing gives you a whole new reason to do Practice sessions, and allows you to upgrade your car. For now, they are a fun and informative way to see how you can be getting the most out of your car. Later on, they will probably just be another thing to do to get those research points. Tests include the Track Acclimatisation Test, the Tyre Wear Test, and a Qualifying Pace Test. All fairly self explanatory. The only issue I have encountered has been with the Tyre Wear Test, as I couldn’t complete it at all. It wasn’t because the tyres were degrading, but because I couldn’t set a laptime that was quick enough for it to count. Although that was frustrating, it boils down to my skill with the game, and how I am driving a Sauber for my Career Mode seasons. Car upgrades are chosen by you, and you have multiple areas for improvement available. Other teams will upgrade around you as well, so if you aren’t moving forward as a team, you’re moving backwards. Upgrades are done with research points, which you gain from the practice testing. The better you do in the tests, and the more objectives you hit, the more points you get to create a dream team.     The formation lap, manual starts, and manual pit entry add a greater sense of realism and difficulty. The formation lap allows you to heat your tyres and brakes, while warming up for when the lights go out. If there is one thing I would highly suggest is to use the manual start feature. It isn’t hard, and allows you to get a great start, as opposed to every other version where you would be guaranteed to not get away well. I have found around 12000RPM is a good spot to be in, although that was just me testing in a few different cars. Manual pit entry lets you brake for the pit lane, which could allow you to gain on, or even overtake other drivers. Penalties will be awarded for speeding, so practice trying to find the perfect spot to start braking. Just make sure you don’t get a “speeding in the pits” penalty while serving your previous infraction for speeding in the pits.     A new damage model gives the gameplay that ever needed realism. Instead of just a “Full” damage option, there is one more called “Simulation.” Now, if you hit the wall, or touch the rear wing of another driver, you will lose parts accordingly. When your tyre does come off, it is attached to tethers, which will keep it with the car.     What goes hand-in-hand with complete carnage? Safety, because you can’t have one without the other. The safety car makes its return to the game, and brings along its younger sibling, the Virtual Safety Car, or VSC. While the removal of the safety car in previous versions might have just been a PR move to “bring it back” for more hype, I can’t complain now that it is available. You have complete control under the safety car, but I wouldn’t go passing other drivers while it is on track, or pass the safety car itself. Bad ideas. While under the VSC, you must keep to a delta time between the cars around you, or you will get penalised. Like the safety car, you still have full control under the VSC. Maybe try changing your strategy when the safety car comes out, and also be ever alert when it is returning to the pits. You can make up serious ground on those around if they aren’t paying as much attention.Here are some awesome things about F1 2016. Career Mode makes its return. Multiplayer works! You can have great battles without incident! Ten season career mode with dynamic car upgrades. Practice testing which allows you to gain data to improve your race pace. Formation lap to warm tyres and brakes. Manual starts allow you to get a lightning start. Manual Pit Entry. Simulation damage. Safety and Virtual Safety Car. Rainy conditions are hard to drive in but can be rewarding based on the circumstances. Great looking graphics. The sounds are really well done. The kerbs seem more aggressive. Time of day controls. Pre-race tyre allocation settings, as well as a revamped race strategy page. The laptop which shows rivalry and team information before a race. AI failures and incidents. Ultimate AI, so if you think you’re good, you realise that you aren’t. Better menu system The Baku street circuit, as well as changes to other circuits to mirror real life. Addition of Haas and Renault.     The one issue that I have ran into is how the menu stays on the last selected item. If I quickly want to rewind, but I last went to the garage, the selection is still on Back to Garage. It has cost me qualifying quite a few times. Not sure if this issue is "working as intended" or if it is something that could be fixed.     Multiplayer works really really well from the races I have done. Side by side battles worked out flawlessly, and there was no hopping around. The aliens have disappeared!     If you are worried about the recommended spec level, I run with a Xeon E3 1231v3 and a GTX 970 with great performance.      I love this game so far, and Codemasters has really stepped up their game from last year. Community input, testing, and communication shows that they do care about our racing experience. I look forward to playing it whenever I can.Spoiler Alert Hamilton wins. No specific race, he just wins.

content:
19, 2016
												This is my first F1 game since 2013 and I'm not disappointed. The new cars really do feel different and you can feel the torque they all talk about :) The graphics are great, though I haven't seen them in all their glory with a race in the wet. All the tracks so far look awesome, with a lot of detail. Sound is perfect and lower revs make for a much more enjoyable experience with the volume up.They have obviously put some love into this game and not just rehashed an older version, so far I like little touches like your lap time being read back to you.Anyway, back to it.Edit: I've fallen in love with it. I'm running it at max at 2715 x 1527 and the tracks look amazing. The handling is awesome too, I hate it when people think games are not sims unless you're spinning it every two seconds, driving isn't that hard, so a simulation of it shouldn't be. You can really spice this up though by simply removing antilock brakes and it adds a lot when you lock up like a pro.I particulally like the Time Trial set up with your next rivals ghost instantly loading as you beat one and it's fun to think that people will be racing yours.Thoroughly recommend it 10/10

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
er 11, 2016
												Pros:+ Career Mode: Back to the series, and better than ever, career mode is pretty detailed, customizable and fun. I hope Codemasters had learned the lesson with F1 2015 and never fail to invest in a career mode.+ Research and Development: the best R&D mode of the whole series. Performed during training sessions, the challenges are fun and challenging, and teach you how to conserve tires, fuel and understand the track.+ Difficulty levels: With 8 levels of difficulty, and several customizable help systems, the game allows the players to maintain a challenge level perfectly compatible with their abilities.+ G27: Perfect compatibility with the Logitech G27.Cons:- Graphics: Very very bad. Codemasters continues to recycle the same graphics engine since 2010. The game looks like a 2013 game at most. With bad textures, terrible shadow effects, reflection and water, the game disappoints a lot in that aspect. The optimization is reasonable on the track, however in the garage it's awful, and it drops below 40 fps on a GTX970 + i7.- System of rivalry: During the career mode the game always keeps you with an active rivalry, without any use. You earn nothing after winning the rivalry, and immediately a new rival is announced, and sometimes it is the same rival already defeated!- Control in the rain: it may be my lack of ability, but I continue with extreme difficulty in running in the rain. The lack of grip does not seem realistic to me. We do not see the F1 cars sliding all the time in the real races.- Accidents: the most annoying aspect of the game. It remains the same F1 2015 problem, which opponents touch you in the back as if you did not exist! And in ALL the touches, including the small ones , you are always the disadvantaged. Your car will fly off the track and opponents do not move 1 cm. Frustrating!Verdict: With a new customizable and full career mode, fun R&D mode and adjustable difficulty, the game remains fun for dozens of hours. Despite the dated graphics and flaws in collision mechanics and control in the rain, the game can be considered the best of the whole series.Score: 8.5/10

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
19, 2016
												This is my indepth review of F1 2016, sorry for the length but enjoy reading!!F1 2016 adds depth to that detail, its career mode returning after a year's absence more fully featured and less fussy than before. From the outset you're free to sign up with any team on the grid, electing to help push Manor that little bit further up the grid or maintain Mercedes' stronghold on the top steps of the podium. Within that, there are now some neat new kinks.The UI is busy, but necessarily so - there's a lot of data to convey, and unlike previous entries it's now possible to read a race from one single screen.Perhaps F1 2016's greatest achievement is how it's managed to make practice sessions meaningful - something that's eluded many racing games before it. Sit in your cockpit in one of the three practice sessions that precede a race - all set at the correct time of day, so you'll be able to see the Singapore street circuit in a low evening sun before the floodlights kick in - and you're able to select a number of practice programmes, the successful completion of which will net you resource points you can then spend on improving the car.The programmes themselves are mini-games that don't feel out of place amidst F1 2016's quest for realism. Simulate a qualifying run by hitting a set time over three laps; acclimatise to the track by hitting gates that mark out the entry, apex and exit point of each corner; take a set of boots and prove you can tread gently in three laps of tyre management. F1 2016 could certainly benefit from a little more variety in the tasks it gives you in these sessions, but Codemasters has succeeded in injecting purpose in a race weekend outside of what happens on Sunday afternoon once the lights are out.Outside the races themselves there's some slim but effective extras: the virtual paddock from F1 2010 returns, complete with a roster of familiar faces (Eric Boullier! Toto the Wolf! Maurizio "I'd kill to look like you when I'm 60" Arrivabene!), and it's here you can keep tab on contract offers, how you're faring against your team mate, and other rivalries that crop up over the course of a season. F1 2016 generally does a better job of immersing you in the wider world of F1, from the cutaways before each race that take in the bustle of the grid to the post-race formalities. Codemasters' engine might struggle to render flesh and bone the way it does carbon fibre and steel - witness the sallow-skinned, dead-eyed horror of many of its character models - but the effort is appreciated all the same.When all of F1 2016's elements work together, it can make for some real magic. Take one particular race early on in my own campaign. A downpour before the lights in Shanghai leading to a sodden track (one area where F1 2016 deviates from the real thing, thankfully, is that Charlie Whiting's not on hand to make sure you can't have some fun in the rain), with the first 8 laps taking place in treacherous conditions before the skies brighten. As lightening burns its way into the track it's a game of nerves, waiting for someone to blink until Sergio Perez is the first onto intermediates, a notification popping up that he's just set the fastest lap by some margin kick-starting a mad dash for the pits. Lose yourself to it and you can easily convince yourself this is the best F1 game on console in an age.There are still faults to be found. The AI sometimes makes some funky calls - with two laps to go of one race and running in second place well clear of any competitors I was told switching over to a third tyre compound would be the optimum strategy at that point, an offer I politely declined - and it's still an F1 game that's complete with all the limitations and restrictions that particular licence implies. If you've any love for the sport, however, F1 2016 can be exquisite stuff. So intoxicating have I found its take on the sport that for me this isn't just Codemasters' most accomplished F1 game to date - it's the developer's best take on circuit racing since the heady days of the TOCA series.

content:
19, 2016
												One of the best AAA launches I have experienced over the past few years. And certainly the best, most comprehensive F1 game I have played (since 2012), if not THE BEST ever.I will update the review with more hours put in, but as of now, here are my early impressions.Pros - 1. Superb presentation - cosmetic elements, "character" etc in the career mode brings life to the single player gameplay, something a lot of simulators ignore now-a-days.2. Still early days, but I have faced zero technical issues, no stuttering or FPS drops, no crashes, no bugs or glitches. A refereshingly stable AAA release as far as I am concerned. (Win 10, 6700K, Strix 1070, 32GB)3. Plethora of settings to tweak realism, assists, controls and difficulty - lets you enjoy the game exactly how you want. Again, something that is lacking in most indie or AAA games these days.4. Codemasters have been listening to their players. This game is choke-ful of community requested features that multiply the feeling of authenticity of the F1 experience it offers.5. Gorgeous yet un-demanding graphics.6. I am no expert when it comes to handling / physics etc. Sold my G27 for a XBONE controller sometime ago to save space. However I am having lot of fun driving in this game, more so than 2013 - 2015, which is all that matters to me.Cons -1. So far, the only thing I find lacking is car sounds. I have no idea if the current car audio is "realistic" or not, since I have never driven an actual open-wheel car. But for a videogame, the audio can be much more impressive. The ambient sounds are perfect though._______In conclusion, F1 2016 seems like the culmination of years of development of this series. A near-perfect F1 / Racing game. Well done Codemasters.

number of helpful: 6 of 10 people (60%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
er 16, 2016
												I can appreciate a good driving game. I picked up F1 2013 about a year ago and became almost fanatical about Formula 1, with 3 full-length, 100% race length seasons completed with much enjoyment. F1 2016 seemed to be a natural choice as a next game, with updated graphics and car models bringing my racing experience into the current season.I thought it a safe assumption that as my system fully covered the recommended requirements, that this game would play like a charm. I was only right to a limited extent. While a quick race (to test it all out) seemed to fulfil all my expectations, I quickly found that the game crashed reliably at the start of every time trial and every career I began, rendering it unplayable in any meaningful way.Finding that these kind of technical issues were a more-or-less widespread problem, I contacted Codemasters technical support to receive no response and accompanied by no visible reassurance that they were working on the issue.So for me, F1 2016 joins a trend of games that appear to promise a lot but are fundamentally broken for at least a certain volume of players and for an appreciable time after release. Rather than this becoming one of the games that I might be tempted to check back on every few months to see if it is finally playable, I'll be pursuing a refund instead.I consider it a shame, considering the official title should be the only way to definitively experience a popular sporting event from the inside, with nearly all other attempts to simulate F1 falling short in some way or another. Codemasters could have done better to prepare their game for mass consumption, support it well and use their position as an official vendor for an F1 simulation with an ethical responsibility to fulfil the expectations of their player base more comprehensively. When there seems to be little-to-no appreciation that their customers have ended up with a problematically supported and broken game, further compounded by a lack of assistance or reassurance that it will be fixed, Codemasters should really look at their policies with intent to improve the overall situation, or risk losing a lot of business.So after a good day-worths work confirming that their game should run without a problem and that there were no issues with my PCs performance, that's where I personally stand on the issue. Diminished confidence in a design house that already enjoys a reputation of rocky reliability, as a result of a game which is unplayable for a wide spectrum of computers and (specifically, it seems) graphics cards which they purport to support.I'm sure I could be a rabid supporter of the game if it had delivered on its promise. But an unreliable game with little reliable technical assistance garners no recommendation.Possibly worth a buy if you are entirely prepared for the hassle of installing, reinstalling, validating caches, wasting time trying a plethora of different graphics settings, drivers etc. to see if it works. And proceeding with the hassle of the refund process if it doesn't. If you've got a spare day or two, you're welcome to the challenge.

content:
22, 2016
												Bought this on day of release and was forced to use a keyboard, was hugely enjoyable so i decided to go out and buy an XBox One controller for the PC the next day.Wow!I have clocked up just under 14 hours play in a weekend.  The immersion in the career mode and the satisfaction in finishing in the top 5 while driving for an underdog team is huge.The thrill of the race combined with the graphics, the racer AI, the commentary, the car setups, rivalries with other drivers......there is so much depth - i spent a fair bit of time marvelling at the tv style screens from the garage watching other drivers on their qualifying laps.Graphics: 9 (repeatedly found myself doing playback to watch the scenary or for events)Sound: 8 (sometimes it can be repetetive in regards to voicing, but the sound of roaring engines compensates)Lastability: 9 (I am 5 races in running at 50% real lap distance.  I see myself going the distance more than once).Immersion: 9 (Very realistic career mode and during the race).Enjoyment: 10 (The thrill of tearing past someone at 200mph while making an overtake to make first on the last bend only to suffer catastophic gear failure and end in 3rd place was a moment of sheer omgness :D )Final Score: 45/50 : 90%
